title: Cardi B celebrates her grandma's 80th birthday in Dominican Republic before playing music festival
text:
Cardi B was swamped on Sunday, but got things done.

The I Like It songstress, 26, visited the Dominican Republic with sister Hennessy Carolina, 23, to celebrate her grandma's 80th birthday, TMZ reported.

The party included a performance from renowned accordionist Fefita la Grande, and a clip of the Grammy-winning artist dancing alongside Fefita was shared on Instagram by writer JC Jiménez.

Busy day: Cardi B, 26, on Sunday visited the Dominican Republic with sister Hennessy Carolina, 23, to celebrate her grandma's 80th birthday (L) then traveled to Austin, Texas to perform at the Austin City Limits Music Festival

In the clip, Cardi, whose full name is Belcalis Marlenis Almánzar, wore a form-fitting beige gown and moved to the salsa beat.

The Bodak Yellow performer, according to the outlet, departed the Dominican Republic at around 2 a.m. local time to head to the Austin City Limits Music Festival in Texas, where she was a headliner.

The songstress documented a portion of her traveled on Instagram, as she added commentary to the sights of their departure to the social media clip.

'Alright, we leaving to America. I am on my way to Texas,' she said in the clip, which included a cow on the roadside in one sequence.

Rhythm: Cardi wore a form-fitting beige gown and moved to the salsa beat in the Dominican

Great time: The chart-topping performer beamed alongside renowned accordionist Fefita la Grande

Traveling: The artist shared her travels from the road in the Dominican Republic

She observed: 'Oh s*** we ain't f***ing with deers anymore.'

The outspoken artist, added, 'I don't want to go back to f***ing America, Americans suck, f***ing crazy a** America.'

In social media clips from Cardi and Hennessy's social media, Hennessy watched Cardi onstage while with Kulture Kiari, the artist's one-year-old daughter with her husband Offset, 27, whose real name is Kiari Kendrell Cephus.

Cardi was about 30 minute late for her set at the music festival, according to Austin ABC affiliate KVUE, but pleased fans with a set that included tracks such as I Like It, Money, Press and Girls Like You.

In her element: The Bodak Yellow artist pleased fans with a set full of hits

On top of her game: Cardi performed tracks such as I Like It, Money, Press and Girls Like You
description: The birthday party included a performance from renowned accordionist Fefita la Grande, and a clip of the  artist dancing alongside Fefita was shared on Instagram.
